questions.text: A 40 year old gentleman presented to surgical emergency with history of high grade fever along with severe pain in right upper abdomen of 2 days duration. On examination the patient is febrile and has a tender hepatomegaly. Ultrasound examination revealed a 4cm X 4 cm solitary abscess in the left lobe of liver along with small right pleural effusion. What should be the MOST appropriate management strategy in the patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Ultrasound guided pigtail catheter drainage of the abscess

questions.correct_answer: C. Ultrasound guided pigtail catheter drainage of the abscess

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding fibrolamellar HCC is not TRUE

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: D. Lymph node metastases is uncommon

questions.text: Cantlie’s line which divides liver into right and left extends from

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: From gallbladder fossa to left border of IVC

questions.correct_answer: B. From gallbladder fossa to left border of IVC

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding hydatid cyst is false

options.label: A
options.text: Potassium and calcium are high in hydatid fluid compared to plasma

options.label: B
options.text: Pericyst absent in brain hydatid cyst

options.label: C
options.text: Hydatid cyst of liver most commonly involves segment VII and VIII

options.label: D
options.text: As per WHO classification CE4 & CE5 cysts are inactive

questions.correct_answer: A. Potassium and calcium are high in hydatid fluid compared to plasma

questions.text: A 55 year old alcoholic male presents with a 6X6 cm mass in segment VII of liver. Imaging is suggestive of right portal vein invasion. The serum bilirubin is 6 mg/dl, albumin level is 2.6 g/dl, PT of 6 secs with moderate ascites but no signs of hepatic encephalopathy. He has been bed ridden for the past 2 months and can only carry out his daily basic activities. What is the most appropriate management of this patient.

options.label: C
options.text: CVP guided resection of the mass.

questions.text: Which of the following statements about benign tumours of liver is not true

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Type I glycogen storage disorder is a risk factor for Adenoma

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. Focal nodular hyperplasia is associated with intake of oral contraceptive pills.
